basics.name: Jennifer J. Kim
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: B.A. in Mathematics student at Cornell University, expected graduation May 2025.

education.institution: Cornell University, College of Arts & Sciences, Ithaca, NY
The Gwinnett School of Mathematics, Science, and Technology (GSMST), Lawrenceville, GA

work and research.company: TRIPODS Research Program, University of Rochester
work and research.position: TRIPODS (Transdisciplinary Research In Principles Of Data Science) NSF Participant
work and research.bullet 1: Researched Kolmogorov complexity as a measure of forecastability for retail analytics time series data.
work and research.bullet 2: Modeled seizures and explored surrogate data testing, utilizing methods like Fast Fourier transform.

work and research.summary: Lead weekly sections and tutor students, create assignment rubrics, grade student work.
Managed graduate carrels, assisted patrons at front desk, processed library materials.

extracurricular.organization: Cornell Association for Women in Mathematics
extracurricular.summary: Plan, organize, and lead all social events as undergraduate Social Events Co-Chair. Coordinate and organize community events, e.g. Julia Robinson Math Festival, as Outreach Co-Chair.

One of 500 fellows (less than 4% of undergraduates) recognized by Cornell University for significant work experience, campus and/or community service, and academic achievement. Volunteer for Cornell Tradition-specific events and organizations such as Prisoner Express.
